alert.note: Alert for Burlington; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 09 at 12:57PM EDT until September 09 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Ocean County in southern New Jersey... East central Burlington County in southern New Jersey... * Until 200 PM EDT. * At 1257 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Old Halfway, or 14 miles southwest of Toms River, and is nearly stationary. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Toms River, Beachwood, Holiday City-Berkeley, Bamber Lake, Cedar Glen Lakes, Whiting, Brookville, Holiday City South, Warren Grove, Pine Ridge At Crestwood, Old Halfway, Penn State Forest, South Toms River, Silver Ridge, Crestwood Village, Ocean Acres, Holiday City and Holiday Heights. This includes Garden State Parkway between mile markers 77 and 81. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. In addition to large hail and damaging winds, frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
